intro: Conostylus, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plants typically have compound leaves and produce pods that contain seeds. Conostylus species are often found in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. They play an important role in local ecosystems and are also valued for their ornamental appeal.
